Package it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.controller

Class InitController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.controller.InitController
public class InitController extends Object
Controller used for regulating the login, reconnection and match forming phases

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    InitController​(PlayerHandler client)
    Creates a new initController for the PlayerHandler passed, the current state is set to LOGIN and the client is notified

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    createMatch()
    A player in waiting state receiving this command can now create his own match and so is moved to NUMBER_OF_PLAYERS state
    StateName
    getCurrentState()
     
    boolean
    isNotAccepted​(CtoSMessageType messageType)
    Verifies if a CtoS Message is not accepted in the current State of this controller
    boolean
    login​(String nickname)
    Execute the login action with the given nickname, the controller can evolve in 3 states - LOGIN if the nickname already exists and the related player is connected - RECONNECTION if the nickname already exists but the related player is disconnected - NEW_PLAYER if the nickname isn't saved in the server as currently used After changing state the client is notified.
    boolean
    selection​(boolean choice)
    Handles a player boolean decision in the first phases, can act differently based on the current state of the controller: - in NEW_PLAYER select the modality - in SP_CONFIGURATION_CHOOSE select if you want to play with standard configuration - in MP_CONFIGURATION_CHOOSE select if you want to play with standard configuration - in RECONNECTION select if you want to reconnect to the match, if meanwhile someone else has reconnected to the same match go to LOGIN phase.
    boolean
    setNumberOfPlayers​(int num)
    Selects how many player you want in your match
    void
    setWaiting()
    Sets this controller to WAITING state
    void
    startGame()
    If this controller is in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS it creates a new match with the players that have joined the queue, so this method has to be called only when the queue for the match participants is full The player in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS (the host of the match) has to be the last one that receive this command.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • InitController

      public InitController​(PlayerHandler client)
      Creates a new initController for the PlayerHandler passed, the current state is set to LOGIN and the client is notified
      Parameters:
      client - the playerHandler who is handling the relative client

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentState

      public StateName getCurrentState()
      Returns:
      the current state of this

    • login

      public boolean login​(String nickname)
      Execute the login action with the given nickname, the controller can evolve in 3 states - LOGIN if the nickname already exists and the related player is connected - RECONNECTION if the nickname already exists but the related player is disconnected - NEW_PLAYER if the nickname isn't saved in the server as currently used After changing state the client is notified.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname you want to login with
      Returns:
      true if a login message is accepted in this phase, false otherwise, in that case this method doesn't make any change

    • selection

      public boolean selection​(boolean choice)
      Handles a player boolean decision in the first phases, can act differently based on the current state of the controller: - in NEW_PLAYER select the modality - in SP_CONFIGURATION_CHOOSE select if you want to play with standard configuration - in MP_CONFIGURATION_CHOOSE select if you want to play with standard configuration - in RECONNECTION select if you want to reconnect to the match, if meanwhile someone else has reconnected to the same match go to LOGIN phase.
      Parameters:
      choice - the value of the selection message
      Returns:
      true if a selection message is accepted in this phase, false otherwise, in that case this method doesn't make any change

    • setNumberOfPlayers

      public boolean setNumberOfPlayers​(int num)
      Selects how many player you want in your match
      Parameters:
      num - the number of players that has to participate to the next match
      Returns:
      true if a number of players message is accepted in this phase, false otherwise, in that case this method doesn't make any change

    • createMatch

      public void createMatch()
      A player in waiting state receiving this command can now create his own match and so is moved to NUMBER_OF_PLAYERS state

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      If this controller is in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS it creates a new match with the players that have joined the queue, so this method has to be called only when the queue for the match participants is full The player in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS (the host of the match) has to be the last one that receive this command. If this controller is in WAITING, set it to START_GAME, the player will receive the other information soon.

    • setWaiting

      public void setWaiting()
      Sets this controller to WAITING state

    • isNotAccepted

      public boolean isNotAccepted​(CtoSMessageType messageType)
      Verifies if a CtoS Message is not accepted in the current State of this controller
      Parameters:
      messageType - the type of message you want to verify
      Returns:
      true if is the message type is not accepted
